page.title: 03Transport in Upperton
page.content: Upperton is not very well served with public transport. This can be a problem for some of the inhabitants, particularly the older people. There is just one bus a week which goes to allingford. It runs on a Friday afternoon, but only stays in Wallingford for an hour and a quarter. This is run by the Houses coach Company in Watlington. Most families have at least one car, which is useful as few faciliies are within walking distance. One elderly lady in the village told us that she wither walked to the local shop in Brightwell Baldwin or cycled into Watlington. This is clealy not so easy in the winter.
